cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north-northeastward, crossing Florida’s Big Bend Monday evening, then skirting along/just offshore the SE U.S. coast and moving into the western Atlantic toward the Mid-Atlantic by Wednesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass to Englewood FL and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida Big Bend through the Carolinas and up toward the southern Mid-Atlantic, including coastal Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–35 kt (30–40 mph) possible late Tuesday night into Wednesday as Colin passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the Port of Virginia; primary surge threat confined to Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain 1–2 inches possible Wednesday with locally higher amounts near the coast
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents and short-fused marine squalls could affect vessel operations
